content: disguising your seam with a backwards sl st 12 45 ▪ remove hook from loop ▪ insert hook through 1st st from behind ▪ return loop to hook at the front ▪ pull yarn through to back ▪ tighten loop on hook round 1 17 45 note you can use stitch markers to mark the stitches at sides and/or centre back where you want your increases to be before starting round 2 you can tailor the number of increases you include in this round according to your cat s size if increasing at one side always increase at the opposite side to keep your sweater s shape symmetrical chain 3 does not count as a st tc x 1 each st to 1st side tc increase tc x 2 at side tc x 1 each st to centre back tc increase at centre back optional tc x 1 each st to 2nd side tc increase at 2nd side tc x 1 each st to end of round sl st to join or backwards sl st round 2 22 45 repeat round 1 increasing as before or as needed to fit your cat 6 note round 3 includes creating the leg holes if your cat s size requires it you can repeat round 2 with or without increases before moving on to round 3 round 3 25 10 note a measurement across your cat s chest between the front legs is extremely useful in determining where you place the leg holes in this round to allow for maximum ease of movement you can use stitch markers to mark where you want each leg hole to begin and end increases in this round are optional chain 3 tc x 1 each st to 1st leg hole chain 11 or any number required for the size leg hole you need skip 9 or to where you want your leg hole to end - as a general rule skip 2 fewer than you chain tc x 1 next st tc x 1 each st to 2nd leg hole mirror your work to create the 2nd leg hole so both sides are symmetrical tc x 1 each st to end of round sl st to join round 4 33 40 note a measurement around your cat s ribs behind the front legs is extremely useful in determining the increases and decreases you need in this and the following rounds chain 3 tc x 1 each st to 1st leg hole place the same number of tc as the number you chained either into each chain or into the chain space place increases tc x 2 at sides and/or centre back according to your cat s size and measurements around the ribs tc x 1 each st to 2nd leg hole repeat as you did for 1st leg hole tc x 1 each st to end of round sl st to join note round 5 includes beginning to decrease and narrow the fit of your sweater
